title: Closing the GAP's: Utilizing Good Agricultural Practices

tasks.task: ** Designing and implementing worker hygiene and sanitation measures.
subtasks: ** Identify worker sanitation needs.
** Research and purchase appropriate toilet facilities.
** Source and install hand washing stations.
** Obtain written documentation for toilet and hand washing policies.

tasks.task: ** Ensuring proper storage and handling of crop protection agents.
subtasks: ** Review and improve chemical storage practices.
** Train workers on regular calibration and maintenance of spray equipment.
** Document all crop protection agent use and re-entry intervals.

tasks.task: ** Evaluating and mitigating environmental and neighboring property risks.
subtasks: ** Conduct title and land use history research.
** Map and assess neighboring land use and potential contamination sources.
** Implement physical barriers to prevent contamination (e.g., improved fencing).
** Source and verify compliant fertilizers and compost.
** Establish and maintain application records for all inputs.
** Test and select appropriate water sources for irrigation.
** Document and schedule regular water quality testing.

tasks.task: ** Developing and enforcing GAP training programs.
subtasks: ** Create comprehensive worker training and hygiene policies.
** Schedule regular training sessions and documentation updates.
** Implement protocols for responding to worker illnesses or injuries.

tasks.task: ** Ensuring safe handling and post-harvest care.
subtasks: ** Establish cleaning and sanitization protocols for harvest tools and facilities.
** Monitor storage conditions and pest control measures.
** Label products for traceability and quality assurances.
** Develop pre-shipment and carrier evaluation checklists.
** Collaborate with trusted shippers to ensure product integrity during transport.
